content.description:
A tasty dessert at the end of the day (or warm-up) that gets you to a cool little summit with a great view. The crux is steep pulling on positive holds at the start (very well protected with bolts). After the 4th or 5th bolt the angle and difficulty ease up, and bolts become more spaced. 

  Be careful with a 60m rope on this route! Ours made the rappel with about 1 foot to spare. 

  If you know the name, FA, or grade of this route, post a comment and I will update this page. Don't trust my rating.
content.protection: This is essentially a sport route (8-10 bolts?), but most will want a piece between the last bolt and anchor. Bomber medium nut or small cams could work.
content.location: The south face of the spire, this route faces Be All End All.

content.description:
This is the pointy spire located immediately northwest of End Pinnacle. It has at least 2 routes on it. Not a destination in of itself, but a worthwhile addition if you're in the area.

 If you know the name of this spire, let me know and I will update this page.

 The spire between Vortex Dome and End Pinnacle
